result.execSummary:
The defendant Tracy C Beard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 01/01/2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 10 days jail, consecutive for non-payment. 

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Straight Time.  Concurrent with present sentence.
Concurrent with: Current sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tracy C Beard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Tracy C Beard in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Kershek requests to go to plea/sentencing today. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 (enhancer stricken). State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT #1:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

___ 90 DAYS JAIL (Straight time) ***CONCURRENT TO CURRENT SENTENCE***

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.


COSTS:  $243.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $25/month commencing on 01/01/16 alternate is 10 days jail).
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 11/30/15.

Defendant Tracy C Beard in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests a 45 day adjournment.  Court adjourns.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Tracy C Beard
Current: 4750 N. 31st Street   Apt  #3, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 08-14-2015)
Prior: 4750 N 31st St, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Attorney Kershek informed the court that he in stuck in Milwaukee County this morning.  Court adjourns this case to 3:00 p.m. today (Defendant is in custody).
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 10/05/15.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 10/05/15.

Defendant Tracy C Beard in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests an adjournment as he did not realize Defendant was in custody.  Court adjourns.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant/victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint or Brookfield Square Mall.

Defendant Tracy C Beard in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defendant allowed a non collect call.  Bail can be reviewed before the Judge.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
